intro: Oreinotinus microcarpus, commonly known as the small-fruited orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant features a slender, often匍匐的 rhizome with a few erect, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and usually greenish or brownish, with a faintly fragrant scent. Oreinotinus microcarpus is characterized by its unique floral structure and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
